properties.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 12 at 7:33AM CST until February 12 at 10:30AM CST by NWS Fort Worth TX
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Fort Worth has issued a

* Flood Advisory for...
Southeastern Denton County in North Texas...
Southwestern Collin County in North Texas...

* Until 1030 AM CST.

* At 732 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain that will cause
urban and small stream flooding. Areas that are low lying or
usually experience poor drainage are most likely to experience
flooding in the advisory area.

* Some locations that will experience flooding include...
Plano, McKinney, Carrollton, Frisco, Denton, Richardson, Lake
Dallas, Lewisville, Allen, Flower Mound, Grapevine, Wylie,
Coppell, The Colony, Southlake, Sachse, Corinth, Highland Village,
Addison, Lake Dallas and Lake Lewisville.
properties.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood
deaths occur in vehicles.

Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause flooding of small
creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as
well as other drainage areas and low lying spots.

A Flood Advisory means river or stream flows are elevated, or ponding
of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
